channel.title: GTA: IV borrowing
channel.description: I had GTA: IV for a few weeks, and then it got stolen. So I was wondering if I downloaded a copy of it, and played it on an Xbox Hard Drive account, and didn't connect to the net, would my Xbox Live Account get banned. Or will my Xbox 360 get like Blacklisted or something.

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @spankjava spank
item.description:
@spankjava wrote:

Ive tryed flashing my xbox

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:11, topic:210649”]Don’t chip your 360s. Flash the disk drive.

I have two 360s both done that way, and I’ve done three of my friend’s.

I don’t have a single “real” game, everything is burned, and we’ve all been playing on live for almost three months.

None of us have been banned yet, and I’ve had mine a lot longer then theirs.[/quote]
SomethingToHide, please tell me, I can’t change the change book type settings in ImgBurn, can I still burn a game correctly?

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

I don’t want to play online, I just want to know if I am disconnected from the outside world, can I play GTA: IV without getting caught.

If it is sitting on your harddrive there is a posibility if you go online. If its on a disk just take out the ethernet.

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Don’t chip your 360s. Flash the disk drive.

I have two 360s both done that way, and I’ve done three of my friend’s.

I don’t have a single “real” game, everything is burned, and we’ve all been playing on live for almost three months.

None of us have been banned yet, and I’ve had mine a lot longer then theirs.

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:8, topic:210649”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=277507.msg2263063#msg2263063 date=1212868375]
I don’t want to play online, I just want to know if I am disconnected from the outside world, can I play GTA: IV without getting caught.
[/quote]Well, regarding sanga’s post, I still wouldn’t risk it. It would be just as easy of Microsoft saved some kind of a hash/checksum related to your CD. Even if you were NOT connected to the internet, the hash could be checked for legal/copyright purposes once you DO reconnect as the hash was saved to the hard drive.[/quote]

That’s what I figured.

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

People who use chipped machines on live don’t get banned because they know how the system works and are not dumb, and even they make mistakes. If you are not 90% sure on the checks made and what you have to dodge, you are going to get banned.

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:7, topic:210649”]I don’t want to play online, I just want to know if I am disconnected from the outside world, can I play GTA: IV without getting caught.[/quote]Well, regarding sanga’s post, I still wouldn’t risk it. It would be just as easy of Microsoft saved some kind of a hash/checksum related to your CD. Even if you were NOT connected to the internet, the hash could be checked for legal/copyright purposes once you DO reconnect as the hash was saved to the hard drive.

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

If it’s correctly burned and patched you shouldn’t get banned atleast easily, but I wouldn’t risk it, since the cheapest xbox costs about 200€ (here in finland).

Read full topic

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

well let me say something form a experience that made me piss my self.
my mate has 3 chiped, black listed xboxes Currently on his 4th.
how did he get cault the other 3 times? he connected to Xbox Live a week before the game was released eg he was playing Halo he got bored went on multilayer on line got blacklisted. he done that 3 times… he can play on line long as he ain’t a fool
#]

Read full topic

pull out your ethernet cable

item.title: GTA: IV borrowing
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Sometimes they can, personally I wouldn’t risk it.

I’m not sure exactly how they detect such things which is why it’s kind of a “loose” topic.

Read full topic

I had GTA: IV for a few weeks, and then it got stolen. So I was wondering if I downloaded a copy of it, and played it on an Xbox Hard Drive account, and didn’t connect to the net, would my Xbox Live Account get banned. Or will my Xbox 360 get like Blacklisted or something.
